did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: The collection contains two manuscript poems and two letters.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Vance Cheney Collection, Accession #7544 , Clifton Waller Barrett Library, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was a gift from Clifton Waller Barrett in December 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains two manuscript poems "Beyond the Day" and "And Ghosts break up their Graves," both with notes in another hand regarding proof and publication in the Atlantic Monthly.

In an exchange with Atlantic Monthly editor [Ellery Sedgwick],Cheney submits a poem and states he now understands the line from Chapman's Homer "But age, that all men overcomes, hath made prise on thee"; and Sedgwick returns some submissions with thanks.
